content.description: Start in the offwidth under the big tree and climb the easy edges (no pro) to the sloping dirt ledge above. At this point the climb crosses lines with Sweet Surprise. Continue up and into the small gully immediately to the left of the open book. Once through the gully look right for the hand- to fist-size cracks described in Sweet Surprise. Loose rock was rampant at the time of FA, though future cleaning may reveal a pleasant route.

climbs.name: The Right Cheek
climbs.fa: Adam Winslow, Bill Coe, Phil Guidotti, Jim Opdycke 4/4/09

content.description: The right cheek sits directly to the right of Adam's crack and shares the start with Sweet Surprise and Scary. Climb the crack 9' to the left of the large fir tree growing out of the cliff following easy, but poorly protected ledges 50' to a good stance below a well-protected crux move. Traverse left below the small Maple at the top of the 5th class terrain on the Bare Buttress and finish at the same anchor as Adam's crack.
content.protection: Medium to large Hex placements and medium cams. Also, the crux is protected well by a blue alien and more specifically a #11 DMM Offset Nut (the black one). Also, if you think it's worth it, AND if you have a small black tricam AND you have your nut tool with you, you can dig out a small placement halfway up to the crux to protect the easier terrain. I'm not putting a bolt there though dammit!

climbs.name: The Left Cheek
climbs.fa: Adam Winslow, Bill Coe, Jeff Thomas, Jim Opdycke 4/17/2010

content.description:
This fun route is situated directly to the left of Adam's crack and stays closer to the left side of the buttress and finishes at bolt anchors with steel biners.

Recently this route was bolted by a guy who does training with S&R. They bolted it so they could train on cliff rescue, or so I heard.

climbs.name: Bill's Thrill
climbs.fa: Kyle Silverman, Bill Coe, Justin Pattison and also Jim Opdycke as injured ground crew technical adviser. 2/27/2010

content.description: Shares same start as White Lightning and instead of traversing left into the White Lightening upper crack at the 1/2 way point, stay slightly right and up the obvious crack, past a small tree to the shared anchor on top.
content.protection: Small rack of cams from 1/2"-2" with some small to medium wireds and some long runners to tie things off.

climbs.name: Adam's Crack
climbs.fa: Adam Winslow, Bill Coe, Jesse Hudson 1/31/09

content.description: Climb using the crack and large face holds up to a small obvious maple tree where the route eases. Consider clipping a sling high on that to keep the rope running freely. Head up to the large Doug Fir and rap off the ring on the tree. A bolted anchor was considered but rejected for this route.
content.protection: A few small nuts and cams to 1-1/2" although there are plenty of great placements for smaller gear and hexes. This would be a great first gear route for a potential aspiring leader and has been aid climbed by numerous parties.

climbs.name: White Lightening
climbs.fa: Kyle Silverman, Bill Coe, Jim Opdycke, Bryan Schmidt. 6/28/08

content.description: Around the buttress to the East of 2tardforU and Happy Crack is a bowling alley kind of valley which is basically an oversized chimney, surrounded by walls 14' apart up a wide finger or thin handcrack that eases to the right and leads to some large face holds to an obvious move left, pull the bulge then straight up to finish. Rap the anchor or pull a few dirty moves to belay off a tree and head to the car.

Start at the shared start of The Right Cheek. Once above the lower face traverse right about ten feet and climb up good edges to an open book. The open book has easy and fun moves and the top features great hand and fist jams. After exiting the open book step up to two hand to fist size cracks that are about two and a half to three feet long, being careful not to disturb the loose rock to the left. Finish at the tree and either walk off or rappel.

climbs.name: Snake Buttress
climbs.fa: Bill Coe, Kyle Silverman, Jim Opdycke

content.description: Start on the Happy Crake and traverse to the right down low, or start to the right of that, just left of Snake and traverse into the buttress higher up. Up the face holds to the Snake or Happy Crake finish. Nice climb with nice ledges.
Start up the White lighting gully and follow the Snake like crack that wanders up and right. Finish at the fir tree 20' from the top, or finish off on Happy Crake.
content.protection: Small standard rack, a #3 Camalot near the top is helpful.
